definition: to be above/to place above
surname Ling
to approach/to rise high/thick ice/to insult or maltreat
surname Jia
to harness/to draw (a cart etc)/to drive/to pilot/to sail/to ride/your good self/prefixed word denoting respect (polite 敬辞)

sentences.english: The materialistic pattern of life is one in which money predominates over everything.
sentences.chinese: 真正的拜金主义生活方式是让金钱凌驾于一切之上。
然而，法院下达的命令有时候会凌驾于这条规定。

sentences.english: Does our gut instinct for self-preservation override our moral reasoning?
sentences.chinese: 自卫的本能凌驾于道德之上吗？

sentences.english: We have allowed the means by which we live to outdistance the ends for which we live.
sentences.chinese: 我们放任生活的手段凌驾于生活的目的之上。

sentences.english: There he stood, grown suddenly tall, towering above them.
sentences.chinese: 他站在那儿，忽然变得极其高大，凌驾于他们之上。

sentences.english: Melodies of life, To the sky beyond the flying birds - forever and beyond.
sentences.chinese: 生命的旋律，直到凌驾于飞鸟的天空，永远在那彼端。

sentences.english: No individual shall overtop the law.
sentences.chinese: 任何个人的权力都不能凌驾于法律之上。

sentences.english: Often the warlords operate above the law.
sentences.chinese: 这些军阀经常凌驾于法律之上。

sentences.english: but no one's above the President.
sentences.chinese: 而没人能凌驾于总统之上。

sentences.english: Thus Nimrod ascribed to himself power and authority over his fellow man and ruled them.
sentences.chinese: 因此宁录以他的权威凌驾于他的子民之上并统治他们。

sentences.english: But press freedom does not mean that the press should be above the law.
sentences.chinese: 但是媒体自由并不意味着媒体可以凌驾于法律之上。

definition: supreme/paramount/unsurpassed
to be on an equal footing
paramount/supremacy
to turn up one's nose/to show disdain for/to regard superciliously
control
to stand aloof/to be detached from/to transcend worldliness/untrammeled/unconventional
unsurpassed/unparalleled
to compel sb to obey/to force into submission/to subjugate
variant of 巔峰|巅峰[dian1 feng1]
peer competition/to function as rivals/to make claims as an equal
to overawe/to be scared into submission
the most honorable/the most respected/supreme/(archaic) the emperor
to overwhelm/to overpower/overwhelming
to excel/to surpass
to shake up/to deal a shock/(fig.) to stir (sb's heart)
to be equal to/to be well-matched/rival
